website_summaries.verdict: As long as this brace fits, you won't find a better overall brace with the same amount of support in this price range.
pros: An innovative figure-eight design allows for optimal support and protection to help with overall stability
This ankle brace features a bilateral design, ensuring you can use it on the right or left foot with ease
cons: Some consumers, particularly those who are using this brace for activities, find it to be a bit too rigid

customer_reviews.title: WRONG SIZE GUIDE and NO RETURNS
customer_reviews.text: The website description for size based on the second product image with the size chart differs than the product size guide on the product box itself leading consumers to buy the wrong size. I am a woman’s 7 so bought S but product guide then reveals I’m better suited for a XS. For something as important as an ankle brace, this is clearly not usable. And NOT ELIGIBLE for returns.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommend for Ankle Fracture Recovery
customer_reviews.text: After my cast was removed, from a surgical repair for a triple ankle fracture, with dislocation, I used the ASO ankle stabilizer instead of the walking boot. This stabilizer is the same one offered at my Orthopedic surgeon's offer, at a fraction of their price. This brace is comfortable, easy to adjust and it washes well, I would recommend the ASO stabilizer for ankle injury recovery.
customer_reviews.author: jody Sheridan

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money! Sizing inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: I am very unhappy with this product! I measured twice, and ordered according to their sizing chart, but it does not fit like it’s supposed to. There is so much extra material on the sides/heel that I can’t even put a shoe on with the stabilizer, which is the whole reason I purchased it. I tried to return it for another size, but there are no returns/refunds!! I am so frustrated that I wasted my time/money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal Wall

customer_reviews.title: great product AMAZING!!!
customer_reviews.text: the ankle stabilizer is great, not the most comfortable thing though, but amazing... I'm a competitive dancer and I sprained my left ankle in gym class about 3 years ago and I've needed support since then but never found the right brace until now it is amazing and I can still dance in it. It is so supportive yet moveable.. MUST BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous5678

customer_reviews.title: Not returnable if it does not fit.
customer_reviews.text: This does not fit me properly, the ankle part is too tight and the foot part is way too large. I kept it for a week to confirm with my podiatrist at my recheck appointment and she said it would not work for me. I tried to return the product, as it was only tried on, never used, and was informed it is not eligible for return, even though it is well within the typical 30 day return policy. It is unfortunate, as it is hard to find a quality ankle brace when you have wide calves and small feet.
customer_reviews.author: Hokie97Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: ... called a "drop foot" and I had a brace like this one for the right foot from my doctors ...
customer_reviews.text: With having a spinal cord injury I have what is called a "drop foot" and I had a brace like this one for the right foot from my doctors office. This is the same style like the previous one I wear. I have very small feet but with tightening the laces it is comfortable and is only a different brand than the first one I received from my doctor. I am so glad I found this on Amazon for it save me a lot of money, time and travel to get another one for the left foot from my doctor. When I did see my physician he said it was working great. Thank you Amazon for having this available.
customer_reviews.author: Diva

customer_reviews.title: Too Big and no exchange or return
customer_reviews.text: This would be a great product - but I went by the sizing guidelines and it is too big. I went to exchanged or return the item and I can't return it. I am stuck with this medium now that I can't use and I am ordering a small from a different place that does have exchanges and returns.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer R Clark

customer_reviews.title: No support for Achilles and not eligible for returns.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brace for my recovery after an Achilles rupture. There may be side to side support but there is absolutely no support for up and down movement of the foot. I don’t get why this brace got good reviews I really don’t see much benefit. I tried to return but apparently it is not eligible for returns. Utterly useless.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Tsunami

customer_reviews.title: NOT RETURNABLE
customer_reviews.text: I let my 13 yo daughter shop for volleyball ankle supports. We measured her ankle. She checked the higher level reviews. I always look at negative reviews for products, but I let her do this shopping on her own. We bought two. They are complex and she is not interested in "assembling and fitting" these prior to practices or games. Think of tying a Corsett, and the scene from Gone With the Wind and Scarlett Ohara, when the maid had to tie the Corsett for her....so I am out $50 bucks. I love Amazon and returns have been no problem ever until now. One can't even tell these are not returnable without looking at the negative reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: This brace does provide good support and has made walking less painful
customer_reviews.text: This brace does provide good support and has made walking less painful. However, it brace does not have enough padding & has seams that cut into the skin even when wearing thick socks. I have blisters from it. It is very uncomfortable, and not a great option during the warmer weather. I bought this brace in a larger size to see if it would fit better, but that didn't help.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: The size fit perfect, I went with an extra large I wear ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a inbone total ankle replacement about 8 weeks ago. After being in a cast and then aircast boot, I decided to purchase this item because I needed a support for my sneaker when I started physical therapy and walking around with 100% of my weight bearing on my ankle. The size fit perfect, I went with an extra large I wear a 12 wide. It instantly gave my relief as soon as I put it on. I never leave reviews but was confused by what I had read on hear for this product. For the price I paid I am very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Jason K

customer_reviews.title: My bad but their poor review/score
customer_reviews.text: Let the buyer Beware: NO RETURNS! I didn't read the small print and missed this. As every ankle sprain is different, I found that wearing this support actually made my ankle hurt more! And, without being able to try it on first, I had no way of knowing. Although it was purchased via Prime, the estimated time to receive it was too long, so I paid extra for faster shipping-my ankle hurt and I wanted relief. Now I find that my ankle hurts more from wearing it and even more insulting, there is no return! If this article works for you-excellent! However, if it doesn't, there is not returning it.I am out $30! My bad but their poor review/score.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Parodi

customer_reviews.title: Boy was I wrong!
customer_reviews.text: A few days ago I gave this ASO product a poor review. I had contacted the the maker MedSpec because Amazon did not offer an exchange or refund online. My initial experience with the ASO didn't seem to provide the support I needed. MedSpec gave me an Amazon number which I called and they offered me a full refund and the options to keep, throw away, donate the ASO. I thought I should give this ASO another try. Not only did it give my ankle satisfactory results, after wearing it all day, my ankle felt amazingly stronger after removing it. I will be contacting Amazon and have them reverse my refund. It's the right thing to do.
customer_reviews.author: J K

customer_reviews.title: Brought little to no stability. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I play volleyball, and I was looking for a stable ankle stabilizer. I thought this would do the job, considering this is the product most of my team mates use, but I’ve found it just does not work for me. It doesn’t tighten and give me the stability I was looking for in a brace. My range of motion is limited and the comfort is awful. Trying to wear this stabilizer with my shoes is a pain. I would not recommended this stabilizer. It did not serve its purpose. It is very mediocre. Look around and do some research before buying this product. If I could return mine I would, but my return window expired.
customer_reviews.author: Makieyaa shirley

customer_reviews.title: Great for Basketball
customer_reviews.text: I injured my ankle playing basketball roughly 5 weeks ago and my doctor recommended this ankle brace prior to returning to the sport. I made use of it yesterday and today and let me tell you, it's well worth the money (which is only like $24 dollars). It provides stability, allows for enough range of motion to play sports, and is comfortable enough to wear for hours on end. For all those who complained about the sizing chart, I didn't have that issue. I wear a 10 or 10.5 usually and have a regular foot in terms of width, so I got a medium and that fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: SlickRick

customer_reviews.title: Closure strap too short, won't fit around leg.
customer_reviews.text: Beware, just because you order your correct size DOES NOT MEAN the Velcro closure that goes around your leg just above your ankle will fit. I wear a size 9 women shoe and ordered a medium. The basic boot and lace up part fit fine but there was not enough length to Velcro the closure straps together around my leg. This is a non returnable item so I will have to eat the cost and gerryrig an extension of some sort so it will strap closed. I am a therapist and there is absolutely no reason the closure straps couldn't be a little longer or even trimable.
customer_reviews.author: Mimo

customer_reviews.title: Two braces both came apart after a couple of months of use.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two of these. One to wear and one as a backup for my daughter. The first brace lasted a couple of months and then started coming apart. That one was garbage, second brace didn't even make it a couple of months and is now breaking apart as well. The sewing keeping these things together should be way stronger. If a 16 year old girl can't use these successfully, an adult definitely isn't going to have much luck. We did feel that they gave her good stabilization and liked the overall fit and design, but I need things to last longer than a couple of months. That's a lot of money to just throw away.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Help for Osteoarthritis in Ankle
customer_reviews.text: My ankle is collapsing due to osteoarthritis but I need to walk (weight-bearing exercise) for osteopenia! The podiatrist tried to sell me what appeared to be this exact ankle brace for $150.00. Um, no thanks. This brace is works very well! I wear a women's shoe size 12W, but I only needed a medium size ankle brace. If it's too big, it can't do it's job. By the way, the podiatrist advised me NOT to wear this all the time, only when I walk for exercise. I neglected to ask why, but I pass the advice along to you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I had a high ankle sprain and a doctor from my wife's church recommended this brand. He said he had personally used it after multiple sprains. It is excellent. Laces up, wraps under and over the foot on both sides, and has a Velcro strap that is the final protective feature. I finally got the courage to run with this the other day (1month 3 weeks after injury) and it worked great. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: cenobite

customer_reviews.title: But it is the best post-boot support I've found
customer_reviews.text: I was in a boot for a month due to a partial tear in my posterior tibial tendon. I still need support for the over-pronation that contributed to the tear, and usually an orthotic is all I need. But when things start to ache, a day in this wrap helps stop the damage. This is not a boot, and is not intended to hold your ankle rigid. But it is the best post-boot support I've found. I even got a second one for my other foot, which bears the burden when my "bad" ankle is stressed. You control the level of support by pulling the straps up. Watch the video to be sure you put it on correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Mary in Maryland

customer_reviews.title: It fits. It's not uncomfortable. It works.
customer_reviews.text: Interesting. I'd not believed that straps alone could stabilize my ankle. I'd developed foot drop and postherpatic neuralgia and had been using a nylon afo, which is pretty uncomfortable, for support. It's also difficult, very difficult to get my foot into a boot, particularly a high boot, using the nylon afo. This strapping device both stabilizes my foot and permits me to wear any of my shoes or boots. I don't think that anything that wraps around your foot or supports your ankle like a nylon afo is ever going to be comfortable, but this this device is at least not uncomfortable. I like it and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: The Green-Piper

customer_reviews.title: Great to protect from ankle rolling
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend these. I have been using them for a few months and have a history of chronic ankle rolling because of my flat, pronated feet. It was unclear from the pictures, but these have a strap that wraps around from each side over the top of the foot similar to how you would get your ankle taped by a trainer. This is very helpful for stabilization of the ankle joint. I have average to narrow size 13 feet and skinny ankles, and a large worked great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Best Ankle Brace I've Ever Worn!
customer_reviews.text: In high school, I used to have a lot of ankle problems and was no stranger to ankle braces. But I was also very picky about them. They needed to have the right support for the ankle (obviously), but also be comfortable. It's been years since I've worn one, but recently, I was needing one, so I ordered this one--best ankle brace I've ever owned! Lace up, heel locks, and a high wrap, make it superior in terms of support. And yet it's extremely comfortable at the same time! If I ever need a new ankle brace, I know which one I'll be ordering again!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I cannot compare this to other ankle supports, but it has done wonders for a flare up of traumatic arthritis in my ankle. Somewhat uncomfortable over bare skin, I have been wearing it over a sock or elastic sleeve ankle support. It is comfortable with shoes, but a little hard to get over slip on type shoes. I wore it daily for two weeks and the pain and swelling is almost gone. I also had a cortisone injection which helped as well. It significantly reduced the pain and limping when I put it on the very first day. I swam with it and it dried quickly. Easy to clean. Easy to put on.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica L

customer_reviews.title: my Orthopedist recommended a brace like this to me
customer_reviews.text: I've broken and sprained my ankle by rolling it outward multiple times in the last few years. There is now permanent damage to the bone area where many of my ligaments attach to, so I have major instability and require surgery to repair it. In the mean time, my Orthopedist recommended a brace like this to me. This is not the most comfortable once it's all snug, but it's way more comfortable than a sprained ankle. 5 stars for making my foot no longer feel like a dead fish tied to the base of my leg. I'm pleasantly surprised at how well this thing works, given the asking price.
customer_reviews.author: David K.

customer_reviews.title: Not stable ,kept shifting
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son after he rolled his ankle on the tennis court. An ankle brace was suggested for him..so I chose this based on its description. My son was not able to use it for more than a few days as it kept shifting from its position and he started to experience a burning sensation in his foot after wearing the brace. It did not work despite the fact he tried it with socks of different thicknesses. This brace doid not work for him at all !!
customer_reviews.author: Abhi R

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased probably 5-6 ankle braces over the last two years while dealing with two ankle sprains due to volleyball injuries. Based on reviews I purchased this one to wear during recovery from the most recent and prepping for my next half marathon when I can run again. I'm happy with this - the wrap around straps for ankle support and final high strap to anchor everything are awesome and I like that I can lace it up because it provides more support and you can adjust to tightness to suit your particular taste. They aren't all so adjustable and also comfy. This fits easily into most of my tennis shoes - a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: MizAlica

customer_reviews.title: different product
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these now. The first was amazing and still use it every day a year later, it saved my ankle (runner). This one looks the same but is cheap, way too big even though the size is the same, its not. It fell apart right away and amazon will not allow you to return them. I wanted another one (for my other ankle, they both are bad) so took a chance and bought a 3rd one and this one was perfect like my first. So 1 out of 3 was junk. I would take the gamble again and count your losses if you get a bad one because if you get a good one its priceless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Great support. I weigh around 250 pounds and I had rolled my ankle and so I couldn’t go for my walks as the ankle was swollen and in pain and then once the swelling and pain went I wanted to start walking and couldn’t. I could start walking again once I bought this and then after a month or so I didn’t need this anymore. I found the laces short so I attached new ones to the existing ones and then it worked perfect for me
customer_reviews.author: Vishal Thachamuchical

customer_reviews.title: Wear these for DH MTB.
customer_reviews.text: I wear these when downhill mountain biking. Bought several different brands and sizes in my search for the right fit, and these were by far the best (better fit than the Shock Doctor ones as well). I wear a women's size 6 shoe, and the XXS (somehow technically pediatric?!? based on ASO size chart) were the only ankle stabilizers that fit snugly. Even the x-small ASO stabilizer was too big. I'd say the price for these was far more reasonable than most as well.
customer_reviews.author: the_sarge

customer_reviews.title: Really saved me during recovery
customer_reviews.text: I had a grade 2 sprain. After using crutches for a few weeks, then boot for a few weeks, I "graduated" to this. It was such a relief to get rid of the crutches and boot. This is such great support, it's literally impossible to roll or sprain your ankle while wearing this. It provided the support I needed while I patiently waited for the swelling to finally go down and for my ankle to regain strength. I weaned myself off of this brace by slowly wearing it less and less until it felt natural to wear nothing at all.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy ankle brace
customer_reviews.text: I'm very familiar with this product. I applied them on patients when I worked for an orthopedic surgeon. Its a well made , sturdy ankle brace. The only problem I had with it was that the material at the bottom irritated my heel where I have plantar fasciitis. The edge of the material was too thick. I couldn't wear it if I had to try to walk. It was too thick and I couldn't get my shoe on, but that was probably from the swelling from the foot fracture ,too. Its a great brace for ankle injuries not for foot and ankle injuries like I had!!
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: Fit can be a problem
customer_reviews.text: I do not even want to give this one star. My foot was measured and I ordered the appropriate size. Figuring I might need a spare, I ordered two. The brace did not fit as described. The fabric cut into my foot even when the laces were relatively loose . When I went to return them I found I was unable to do so. I am HIGHLY annoyed that I am now stuck with 2 "supports" that are useless. I was under the false impression that anything can be returned to Amazon especially unused and in original packaging. Beware. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.author: Monique LaJeunesse

customer_reviews.title: I was surprised that this stabilizer actually works.
customer_reviews.text: I just completed my first 3 mile walk this morning wearing the stabilizer. My ankle didn't hurt at all. My arch hurts some now but I think that is because I haven't made the "stirrups" tight enough. I wore all day yesterday and my ankle/arch area felt good; however, when I removed the stabilizer, my ankle began hurting, perhaps because I need that stability all the time?? All in all, I think this is a great product. I could actually get my running shoes on comfortably. I shall continue wearing every day. The company is great to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Net Picker

customer_reviews.title: Just what my wrestler needed
customer_reviews.text: My son was looking for an ankle stabilizer after tearing a ligament in his foot. His ankle kept rolling and he needed extra support while he was healing. He wanted something that wasn't too bulky, could fit under his wrestling shoe and could give him the range of motion he needed to perform. We looked at major drug stores, pharmacy in the hospital and couldn't find anything quite like this ankle brace. They all were either too bulky or didn't allow him range of motion. This is exactly what he needed and it has held up very well. He's been using it for about 4 months and it is still in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: Monique A.

customer_reviews.title: Overall Solid Mid-range Product
customer_reviews.text: I rolled my ankle pretty badly, so I wanted to take care of it while still being able to stay mobile. I probably could have gone with a more stable brace, but it was good for the compression. I also hoop, so now that I can do a lot more on my ankle but need to continue to protect it while healing, the brace is pretty helpful. The only problem I really have with it is that it bunches a little around my ankle which can be irritating. I think my foot (sz. 9 women's) may be between sizes a little, and the brace isn't quite up to a lot of personal adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: Ps

customer_reviews.title: Lesson Learned..Not returnable
customer_reviews.text: Beware not returnable. I purchased, never took out of the box, brought to doctors to ask him if the brace was ok, he said it was not supportive enough for my injury. I tried to return and they would not accept saying Amazon prohibits returns of used/opened footwear devices as it's against hygiene safety standards. I understand, just wish it was more clear that item was not returnable, if I knew I would have thought twice about purchasing. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: April 21st 2016 i suffered the injury in the attached photo. At week 9 post surgery, i was able to use braces and bought this one. I have been using this brace for when i am working and it helps. I also use this brace during workouts and it keeps my ankle secure. I have already recommended this brace to others with ankle injuries and it was approved by the surgeon who reattached my ankle.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Planner

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit into of my shoes and is not returnable - don't buy unless you walk barefoot
customer_reviews.text: The box says this is superior ankle support-fits easily into any shoe. Although I got the correct size and followed instructions for putting it on, neither I nor my PT was able to get it to fit into any of my shoes, all of which are correctly sized athletic and flat shoes. It doesn't even fit into my slippers, so for me it's useless both in and outside the house. It's not a returnable item, but Amazon was willing to issue a refund because it didn't work as described. But save yourself the trouble and don't bother getting this unless you plan to wear it barefoot.
customer_reviews.author: bunny

customer_reviews.title: Decent brace
customer_reviews.text: A family member recommended this brace after I 'rolled' my ankle while camping (grade 2 sprain). The brace supports the ankle well, but the top cuff is ridiculously tiny - I have small ankles and *not* large-around legs, but I can barely close the top cuff at all. To have it fully closed as recommended with the logo front-and-center would (and did) cut off circulation. It doesn't fit terribly well, but that may be because of the afore-mentioned smaller ankles. I am using size medium and do not believe a small would have been big enough otherwise. Still, the ankle is mending, and the brace helps support the tissue during the process.
customer_reviews.author: M Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Good, solid ankle stabilizer
customer_reviews.text: Good stabilization. Lightweight yet tough material. Only complaint is that it takes a while to get this bad boy on. It held up well on a long nature walk over rough terrain. For myself I should have gotten the one with the plastic stays for added security. Overall this is a great, versatile brace. If you have temperamental ankles and sometimes need added support I recommend this brace! Make sure you measure your ANKLE to get the right fit. The shoe size is a guideline and had I gotten the appropriate for my shoe size one it would have been too small. Only reason for 4 stars is the PITA factor of putting it on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Carla W

customer_reviews.title: Best
customer_reviews.text: Best ankle braces money can buy. I have terrible ankles from basketball and other sports so I used these to stabilize my ankles during a backpacking trip instead of using hiking boots. Not a single ankle issue despite many opportunities with a 45 pound pack.
customer_reviews.author: Chris MurrayTop Contributor: Running

customer_reviews.title: Great for EDS joint support
customer_reviews.text: I have EDS and needed a brace for support and stabilization. I started with one brace just to see how I liked it and ended up ordering a second for the other foot. The fit is great and allows room for me to wear an arch brace, too. I can walk with less pain and more confidence that I won't roll my ankle or dislocate it. This brace also fits in my high tops so I can wear them discretely, too. I've been wearing them daily for over a month and so far they are holding up quite well with no visible wear. When I do wear them out, I'll likely buy another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Lainy

customer_reviews.title: Terrible sizing
customer_reviews.text: I had really high hopes for this after reading the reviews and honestly I am very disappointed. The sizing chart is completely wrong and the item is non-returnable so it’s basically useless at this with all the extra material you can’t even get it into a shoe. Not only that the Velcro is extremely uncomfortable and we will make a noise constantly when you move your foot. I’m sure it was actually correct it would probably be a much better breeze but for now it’s useless.
customer_reviews.author: Mf

customer_reviews.title: Got me on my feet
customer_reviews.text: This product saved me. I was in a motorcycle accident and was struggling with getting back on my feet for work. My Physical therapist recommended this and o can't thank him enough. Also helped me get back on my bicycle to rehab the rest of my leg. I would only change two things. It takes forever to take on and off which can be a hassle. The only other thing is the thickness. You have to be careful with the shoes you wear. I had to buy a new pair of dress shoes and athletic shoes because this wouldn't fit in my current ones.
customer_reviews.author: TruSpadez

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: After severely spraining my ankle two weeks ago, I tried all kinds of things: ACE bandages, an AirCast, a walking boot from my Dr, but nothing compares to the comfort and stability of this brace! It was recommended by a friend who deals with gymnastic injuries, and this is the only brace she sees athletes using. I totally understand why now! I wear a size 8.5 shoe, and ordered the size small, and it fits perfectly. Swift healing wishes to all who may need it, but I predict this product will actually speed up your healing process!
customer_reviews.author: Dana Ferri

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I was born with clubbed feet due to a disability and as I've aged I've found myself walking more on the side of my ankle/foot and actually broke my great toe. My ortho doc recommended I try this to straighten and bring more stability, seems to work very well and there is no trouble fitting in any of my shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Halligan

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - terrible product
customer_reviews.text: This product looks similar to other ASO ankle braces I have loved but it fits differently (runs larger) and the quality is absolute garbage. I wore it once and this plastic lining material was falling off the whole inside layer, you can see some pieces o. The counter in my picture. The stitching and fabric also started ripping to pieces after a single use. Do not buy this it is a waste of money. Total crap.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Overrated and overpriced, not to mention too complicated!
customer_reviews.text: I've got a problem with an ankle brace that NEEDS installation instructions. It's far too difficult to put on and given all the time and effort required, the result is disappointing at best. Frankly I would have returned the brace if it were possible. There is also something very fishy about the sheer quantity of reviews for this product and the percentage of 5 star reviews.
customer_reviews.author: TMART

customer_reviews.title: Can't return
customer_reviews.text: Think extra careful before buying. They wouldn't let you return. I sprained my ankle a few years back. My ankle/foot pain got worse so I needed something to stabilize it. The item is made from some sort of nylon fabric that doesn't have anything firm enough to help keep the ankle in place while you walk. I feel like I could've just wrapped fabric around my ankle rather than wasting money on this. This item made my pain worse since I walked around with it on, thinking it would help.
customer_reviews.author: Picky Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Size down
customer_reviews.text: I went off the recommended sizing chart and went with a large as my sizing came up between 13.25 and 13.5. However, I think a medium would've fit me better even if it were a bit snug. The large is just far too roomy and it doesn't really provide the adequate support I need since it's too big. I was going to return/exchange but the cost of shipping it back was about 1/3 of the price of the product itself. IMO, if you're between sizes, I would say size down.
customer_reviews.author: Gian

customer_reviews.title: My husband has Lymphedema and supination
customer_reviews.text: My husband's foot is is a very bad way. Having said that, the swelling caused us to think long and hard to find a stabilizer for his ankle. He wears a boot to keep his foot straight. It is his left foot so thank God he can drive. This is good around the house and when he elevates his leg. He does like the Stabelizer's wrapping affect. He complaines about the time to put it on, but the lacing up is part of the support as in a high-tech sneaker but better support. Make sure you wrap each straps across your foot and catch each one under your heal on the other side and pull up tightly.
customer_reviews.author: NaturalNotSyntheticSupplements

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly what I expected but seems to work well.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to support my ankle 6 weeks after I broke it. I suppose it does limit the movement of your ankle but it wasn't what I expected. This mainly keeps you from being able to point your foot down. It might help with rolling your ankle from side to side but I can't tell, maybe my ankle is still too stiff the find all the boundaries of movement. Anyway, I still would recommend this. Its pretty comfortable but its difficult to fit it inside high ankle shoes or boots. It does seem to make walking a bit more stable and it seems like it would be good for anyone playing sports like tennis or basketball.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this product over all ankle braces from a biomechanical ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for one of my high school athletes with chronic inversion ankle sprains. I recommend this product over all ankle braces from a biomechanical point of view due to it's medial to lateral straps and the heel lock strap as well. The lace and neophrene braces are garbage alone without these extra straps. The price was also half of that of the local sports equipment store (DICKS SPORTING) and twice as good with regards to quality.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Good brace at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: I got this brace for an ankle that easily rolls due to weakness from MS. It gives solid support when it is first put on. Over time the laces loosen a bit leading to less support, but re-tying after it loosens up isn't too difficult. It's thin enough to fit into a shoe and it has a long lifespan. I use it everyday and am only replacing this one due to losing the original somewhere around the house. Overall it's a good support with better design than an almost identical brace than what I got from my local .orthopedics store.
customer_reviews.author: edward t brown jr

customer_reviews.title: Can finally trust my ankle not to give way
customer_reviews.text: I've had a bad ankle since a dancing injury in high school that has been re-injured far too many times. Took up Aikido a couple of years ago and after a few painful ankle rolls knew I needed to get a Real ankle brace if I was going to continue. This was recommended to me by another women at my dojo who had an old soccer injury. She was right - this brace keeps me from those horrible ankle rolls and lets me get back on the mat without fear.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE...Cheaply made...Company won't accept returns
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it was similar to one I have. When I got it out of the box, it felt too light and cheaply made. Hoping I was wrong, I tried it on. I wasn't wrong. It is probably ok if you need very light stability...but I needed more. When I went to return it, it said not eligible for return. WHAT?! I checked back onto orginal product page...I couldn't find anywhere on the page where it said "NO RETURNS". I contacted Amazon customer service and was able to get it resolved. AMAZON was great!! The company, not so much.
customer_reviews.author: A. Carson

customer_reviews.title: Return Problem
customer_reviews.text: The items were perfect, arrived on time (which was important as theywere need right away) They did not fit, so I ordered another pair (over $60.00) and then went to return the ones that did not fit. Not returnable! so I have called and they said they would send paperwork concerning this. It has been 2 weeks, no paperwork. I have ordered many many items from Amazon without a problem, but this was a costly ;poblem as a first one. Also remember, these are for both men and women, so if you are ordering for a female, dont order a medium, it will be huge, (my first part of the problem. ) My bad!!!
customer_reviews.author: the dentist s wife

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: It is only day 3 of wearing this all day at work, but so far I am pleased. I am on the move off and on all day. I am able to walk up and down stairs with ease. It gives my ankle support with out making it stiff and hard to move. I still am able to wear my work tennis shoes, but can not lie, at the end of the work shift, I am ready to take it off and give my foot a break. It starts to annoy my on the top of my foot by the end of the work day
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan at all
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely not a fan. Bought this in hopes that it would fit in my shoe a bit better than a doctor provided brace and this thing is FAR too much. It does seem to have a fair amount of stability when worn but the way the straps wrap under the heel makes a super annoying crinkling sound whenever you walk. Since this seller doesn’t allow returns, this will be tossed to the back of the closet and my $10 ACE stability wrap will continue to outshine.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie Whitney

customer_reviews.title: This is the one!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a female -wide skewed feet, bad feet by anyone’s standards - I’m a avid nordic Walker, and hiker. This is the one! By far the most comfortable to put in a shoe or sneaker. I use with orthotics and stick on metatarsal pads! It’s light and thin enough not to hurt. Great Multi adjustment. The size chart was accurate for me. Slight break in period to be expected. I purchased for stability and frequent tendinitis (ankle) .
customer_reviews.author: D.D

customer_reviews.title: Flexible and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how to rate these in terms of stability as the range of motion is very good so it makes me wonder how they would actually prevent injury. My daughter is required to wear these for volleyball and although it took her a couple days to get used to them she says they are fine now and do not cause any discomfort. I’m happy they are washable as they get very stinky. She wears a size 7.5 in volleyball shoes and we got her small, They fit well.
customer_reviews.author: V.W.

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately for him and fortunately for me it fit my foot just fine
customer_reviews.text: Bought a medium to determine if it would fit my sons foot. Unfortunately for him and fortunately for me it fit my foot just fine. I injured my foot years ago and was "issued" one ankle support while in the military and it served me well. Unfortunately my original after 15 years started to fall apart. So I planned to purchase this medium that it would fit my sons foot due to a recent injury. His 91/2 foot was a little small for the medium. The medium fit my foot 11 1/2 fit perfect for my foot. I've just recently ordered him the small to accommodate his foot. After fitting the medium I'm sure the small will fit just fine.
customer_reviews.author: biomess

customer_reviews.title: Works great stabilizing my sprained ankle
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to use. Directions were super helpful. I sprained my ankle about a week ago and have a 4 block walk from my bus stop to my office. Brace is MUCH better than crutches! If I don't use it, my ankle gets super fatigued. With the brace, it still gets fatigued but not nearly as bad. Plus I feel like I'm less likely to re-injure it. Oh I also tried one of those big boot things - this brace is WAAAY better.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Hoffmeister

customer_reviews.title: NOT REFUNDABLE /PIECE OF JUNK
customer_reviews.text: This is the stupidest product I have ever bought. It has a shoelace that has to be completely laced and unlaced every time you wear it and take it off. And 4 straps to velcro. Even after all of that there is NO ankle support. I had to have someone else put it on and take it off because of the way it fits. It's not refundable, their website doesn't exist anymore and the support phone # takes you to a number that is M-F and very limited hours. Oh, and I wouldn't give it even 1 star except that the site requires it.
customer_reviews.author: M0mM0us3

customer_reviews.title: This is absolutely the best ankle brace I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely the best ankle brace I've ever had. It is a simple design, sturdy, and fits with whatever degree of snugness I need depending on how swollen or not my ankle happens to be. I've worn it for hours in various activities and it's has not failed me. It's simplicity reminds me of the old high-top Converse basketball sneakers with lots of eyelets for the laces but higher on the ankle, more rugged material and additional support straps. I've worn it prior to and since surgery and probably have logged 100 hours of use and, of course, numerous washings. Still looks and works like new. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Beware of sellers selling counterfeit ones
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these several weeks ago from Amazon as the seller. It worked so well I decided to get a second one. I didn't pay attention to the seller but it was a 3rd party. When I put the second one on I could tell the materials felt less substantial. The brace did not support my ankle as well. Close inspection revealed differences in quality of workmanship and materials. Buy this brace from Amazon as the seller! You can't even return it through the normal Amazon return process. But Amazon customer service came through.
customer_reviews.author: BH

customer_reviews.title: Best for thicc ankled boys
customer_reviews.text: This brace is worth it. I thought I would save a few bucks and got a cheaper brace first. It's sizes were vague and it's quality was poor. I came back and bought this one, which I should have done from the beginning. The how to measure sizing chart makes selecting the right size easy. I was tempted to buy a size bigger because I have really big ankles, but I went with their recommendations and it fits perfectly. It's supportive enough without having to tighten to the point of causing skin damage. My pain from a week ankle sprain had been reduced dramatically. I'm off my cane thanks to this bad boy.
customer_reviews.author: Ama-zong

customer_reviews.title: WHAT WILL THEY THINK OF NEXT!?!
customer_reviews.text: Brace yourself. This brace supported my ankle well. But! It was really hard to do ankle rolls. I tried and it was painfully restrictive to my ankles lateral movement. I would recommend: Not wearing this brace unless you only want to walk or do lite physical activity. I guess it is also good for protection when playing tennis, basketball, and kickball. I wouldn't get this brace unless you really need your ankle supported.
customer_reviews.author: ONNAGA

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a weak ankle, size perfect for a very large foot.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for that pesky ankle that needs a bit of extra support when trekking about uneven steep land or doing a workout that maybe a bit too much without the support. Much better then an ace bandage and much easier then doing the professional athletic taping. Not recommended for daily use, that would just weaken the ankle but when you find yourself not trusting your ankle this is just perfect. I have a very large wide (size 12 EEEEE) mens foot and this X-large fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: A P in Radford VA

customer_reviews.title: Not the ankle support I was expecting.
customer_reviews.text: The 8 pair of eyelets, two long serpentine Velcro belts, and the third Velcro belt at the top made it difficult to both put on and take off brace. Personally, the ankle support was too weak for me. The top of my foot also hurt the following day after use. This product may be better suited for some users. I found my elastic support socks provides far more support and are also easy to put on and take off.
customer_reviews.author: 67Stang

customer_reviews.title: Amazing ankle support - allows me to continue running
customer_reviews.text: My 2nd purchase of this to replace one that had worn out. This provides great support and allows me to continue running despite tendonitis in my ankle (posterior tibialis dysfunction). Yes, I probably shouldn't be running to allow the ankle to heal but some of us make terrible patients :) This can be worn with my regular shoes with the laces loosened up a bit to accommodate the increased thickness.
customer_reviews.author: Ama Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Best in the biz, but no returns, so go test one out first!
customer_reviews.text: very specific sizing and superior stability make this ASO shine, but I had to order a Large for sports after getting an XL based on ankle measurement since there was quite a bit of extra fabric bunching up on the XL. both are in range for my shoe size so I'll probably just end up wearing the larger one day to day, and both for hikes and longer walks since my other ankle ain't in tip top shape either.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Burlingame

customer_reviews.title: Best ankle brace I've owned!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I can across this ankle brace! In November, I fractured my ankle in several places. But I only thought I sprained it. After months of slow healing, I still had a lot of pain. After an MRI revealed the fractures, the doctor told me I have arthritis it my ankle now. This brace has significantly reduced the pain! The only reason for a 4* rating is I get a lot of pinching on the inside. I tried taller socks to avoid it, but still have pinching in the inside. But I can deal with that pain than the arthritis! Best brace I have ever used! EVER!
customer_reviews.author: Fernie Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product - Works Well
customer_reviews.text: This is a great ankle stabilizer. I was prescribed another brand my my orthopedic surgeon - it was 3X the price and worked only marginally better than this product. Sizing is a little tricky, and I would encourage you to go to their website and then take measurements around your ankle. Your shoe size is not a good guide. I generally wear an 11 1/2 or 12 shoe and so I ordered the XL - without checking out their sizing chart. The L is a better fit for me. Its not your shoe size as much as it is the diameter of your ankle.
customer_reviews.author: gsorrells

customer_reviews.title: The thin material is much better for longer term comfort
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent brace because the material is strong, but thin. The thin material is much better for longer term comfort. However, the material is a little slicker and your foot tends to slide around a little as a result. This is important because if you use it on your planting foot when kicking a soccer ball, I find that the little slippage can affect your accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: e-tech

customer_reviews.title: They are thin enough to fit inside my shoes without effort but still provide good support. They take slightly longer to put on ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using two of these braces now for over a month and decided to write a review for those on the fence. The short version is “buy them, they are great”. I wear one on each ankle for men’s basketball twice a week. They are thin enough to fit inside my shoes without effort but still provide good support. They take slightly longer to put on with the 3 sets of Velcro but I couldn’t dock any stars as they perform great and are very thin. These will be my go to braces from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Christian B.

customer_reviews.title: Ankle strap too short
customer_reviews.text: I Purchased a medium and I wear a size 7 1/2. I could not get this to fit. The strap with Velcro that goes around your ankle To provide the actual support is too short to go around my swollen ankle/lower leg. UnFortunately this product is also not returnable. If you have a lot of swelling or a larger Calf like I do, I would definitely take a pass on this or look to purchase it from someplace that is returnable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 of these, 2 for my son who plays football and one for myself. We both severely sprained our ankles around the same time, his in football and mine at work. These braces are amazing. They keep tight, and apply pressure and stability where needed. My son returned to football with his and I returned to work as a firefighter with mine. All three held up great and are still in amazing shape to be used again if needed. Would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Hill

customer_reviews.title: Just like the orthopedic brace.
customer_reviews.text: It's almost exactly like the one the ortho doctor gave me the 1st time I sprained my ankle like an idiot. But that was 6 years ago and needed replacing. This is an excellent choice but please measure as instructed. It does make a difference. FYI not an imposter with elastic in weird places it doesn't belong when your foot is swollen either. I made that mistake with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Review Only

customer_reviews.title: A great product that does what it says it will do....
customer_reviews.text: Some how I stepped off the curb wrong last June and I rolled my 58 year old ankle...It didn't break but I stretched and pulled everything in and around it. It was absolutely a bummer summer...my physical therapist recommended this for me after I was out of the boot. It was a Godsend. That's the only way I was able to go back to work a month later. Thankfully it fit in my work shoes. Hand wash hang to dry if needed.
customer_reviews.author: NULIFE

customer_reviews.title: Excellent brace! Provides wonderful stability and is comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic brace. I would recommend it for anyone recovering from a sprain or desiring more stability in the ankle. My only negative (it’s a small one) is that it is slightly bulky. I had a little trouble fitting my foot with the brace into my basketball shoes. Once they were in however, the brace supported my ankle for the duration of my games.
customer_reviews.author: Vik

customer_reviews.title: Provides very good stability, Mobility is somewhat limited and it can cause aching in ankle tendons.
customer_reviews.text: Great stability for hiking up and down steep slopes and made well however they do seem to put more of a strain on my calves and ankle tendons as the stress that would have been imparted to your ankle is transferred to the area the above the ankle joint where the velcro secured wrap around ankle cuff is positioned. If this cuff is made loose enough to not stress tendons ankle support is significantly reduced and IMO not adaquate.
customer_reviews.author: Big Basin Guy

customer_reviews.title: NO RETURNS! Uncomfortable compared to speed lacer.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my daughter and it is uncomfortable and itchy. She had tried my Med Spec ankle stabilizer speed lacer and I thought that’s what I ordered, my mistake. But the laced material is totally different, itchy, and not as supportive. And the company does NOT allow returns. Order the speed lacer and measure your ankle around the heel for correct fit. Do NOT go off shoe size!
customer_reviews.author: Koolfyre

customer_reviews.title: Fits in most of my shoes pretty well
customer_reviews.text: It is best when it's very new. After one wearing, it starts to scrunch down and develops a crease from the heel up toward the ankle. I don't think this affects the function too much, but it can be a little bit uncomfortable on my ankle bone if a shoe hits that spot. It doesn't go away with washing either. However, this brace fits in my shoes better than the other ones I have tried and it seems to offer pretty good support.
customer_reviews.author: Opal in Denver

customer_reviews.title: Very good but some flaws.
customer_reviews.text: Used after ankle and Achilles repair in addition to post op shoe. It stabilizes the ankle very well but beware that this is NOT good if you have swelling. It does not flex at all and cause swelling build up where straps were not. Also, even if you measure I would recommend one size up for the top strap. It’s very tight (even though it’s elastic) and can be very uncomfortable. It also does not breathe so be prepared for sweat. All around, it’s a great brace. If your looking for something to hold your ankle in place it’s awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn P.

customer_reviews.title: Good ankle stabilizer
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived on time. The fitting take some used to but once you figure out how to out them on correctly it is easy. The stabilizer works but it no way a replacement for a full boot style for broken ankle. This is meant as a transition from the boot support or people w chronic ankle issue. It can be used long term and washable. Provides just enough support without feeling immobilized. The shoe brand that did NOT FIT was Solomon Women's hiking shoes. Too tight even with lace loosen all the way. Tennis shoes and casual boots seems to be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Not eligible for returns. Be aware.
customer_reviews.text: Be aware if you get the wrong size like I did in my case it is NOT returnable. I went according to the chart and it was too big and now I am stuck with a brace I cannot get a smaller size of. Will never purchase from here again. So now I’ve waisted money for an item that won’t work. I literally put it on once with clean socks on, and yet I cannot exchange it for the correct size.
customer_reviews.author: Georgiana

customer_reviews.title: ... and the laces criss cross and attach with Velcro easy peasey well this one in the smaller size you ...
customer_reviews.text: I have one in the small and the straps are much bigger and the laces criss cross and attach with Velcro easy peasey well this one in the smaller size you have to lace like a shoe and tie them ..hard to get them tight..straps are narrow and does not off the same support as the Size Small does ...same brand..wish there were pictures of the inside before I ordered....sending it back😕
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me.
customer_reviews.text: FIt is not great. I measured my foot as indicated and ordered the indicated size. The tie strings don't have a lot of extra room when I tighten this up. Pulled it as tight as I could stand and my ankle is still moving around. After an hour or so my leg was in worse pain than before the brace. Took off the brace and the pain went away within a couple minutes. So did nothing to brace my ankle and when tightened up actually hurt worse than the sprain (and still did not brace the ankle).
customer_reviews.author: James H.

customer_reviews.title: Poor instructions
customer_reviews.text: Common sense will guide you with the poor instructions on this product, which is why I marked it down one star. Put the smaller straps over your instep, then under and up on the side of your foot. This gives the side support and can be adjusted as you pull up on them. Be sure to wear a regular sock with this stabilizer or it will rub your leg. It is a really good ankle product, and was recommended to me by a foot and ankle doctor. Just wish the company would upgrade the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Helpful Hannah

customer_reviews.title: The support I needed following 12 weeks of Physical Therapy ...
customer_reviews.text: The support I needed following 12 weeks of Physical Therapy for a Achilles tear, it gives me the walking support and confidence to keep walking at the set pace for me and my recovery, have a long road ahead and this helps me.
customer_reviews.author: TL, Gig Harbor

customer_reviews.title: You Better Know Your Size Returns are Not Accepted
customer_reviews.text: My issue is with the return policy if you buy the wrong size. If you buy a medium for example and find that it is a bit large you are out of luck. Even though a small was purchased and it worked much better. What you then find out is that the original medium that you have only had on to size is not eligible to return. Does the product work? Yes. Just beware of the sizing and return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Peters

customer_reviews.title: Works great to limit my ankle rolling inwards (over pronation) and ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great to limit my ankle rolling inwards (over pronation) and reduce my resulting plantar fasciitis pain substantially. Right now I work a job where I stand/walk all day. Without these braces, I can only work on my feet for about 4 hours/day before the pain becomes unbearable. With them, I can work 8-10 hrs/day with minimal pain. I highly recommend them for flat-footed over pronators.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: ASO Ankle Stabilizer made major improvements
customer_reviews.text: I have a problem with my right foot. The podiatrist called it "foot drop". I did not walk well and did not want to walk very far. The ASO Ankle Support helped me in two ways. First it gave me more stability when walking. Secondly, and as important, the improved stability gave me confidence to walk. My problem was a good part psychological. But now I can walk all over a "big box" store without giving it much thought.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth F. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Great Support, Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: No complaints, purchasing specific items like this in the past has been mostly a bad experience in terms of getting something cheaply put together or not working as intended. I'm happy to say this is not the case with this product, it is excellent all around and does the job it is intended to do along with being designed to fit firmly a broad range of sizes
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: These are sold separately, one per box
customer_reviews.text: very good well made ankle brace. i bought this to replace a brace that was bought three and a half years ago. my daughter plays very competitive volleyball for high school and club ball. it was used daily and finally gave out a few days ago. we couldn't find them locally so ordered from amazon. the problem is i forgot they are sold separately. the other brace shows signs of wear but still can be used. i wanted to replace both so ordered another as soon as the first one arrived. make sure to order two if you need a pair...
customer_reviews.author: R. J. S.

customer_reviews.title: I Like It!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is actually a great product. It is well made. The stabilizer does actually stabilize my ankle. I had to work a bit to get it on correctly. The pictures helped to verify that I had it on as directed. I followed the suggestion on sizing and customers were correct. The small fit my 7.5 foot and I can wear my supportive sneakers without problem. The company who made this (USA) did a quality job!! 3/10/19= updated review. This stabilizer has really helped my ankle pain. I have no problem recommending this product. MJR
customer_reviews.author: mjr

customer_reviews.title: ASO has quality problems now!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two the same day, from the same seller, a small and an extra small. The extra small was like all others I've ordered (I've had 6 pairs since 2007 or so). The small one was a completely different product, made of different materials, and has completely fallen apart in less than 2 months. Has ASO changed their product? It's inferior and I will have to change brands now. Total bummer.
customer_reviews.author: DayTrader

customer_reviews.title: The best. Have tried them all.
customer_reviews.text: BUY A SIZE SMALLER THAN YOU THINK! But, size smaller. We got XL. Returned for Large. My daughter has use the ultra brand ankle braces And she says these give more room and her shoe doesn’t bulge out it lays flat yet has more support takes a little longer to put on more sense of security with these so we’ve had to mcDavid all kinds of others these are the best.
customer_reviews.author: Black

product_meta.title: Med Spec ASO Ankle Stabilizer
product_meta.description: The ASO Ankle Stabilizer is the ankle brace of choice for numerous professional and collegiate athletes. The ASO is also one of the most recommended ankle supports by athletic trainers, orthopedic surgeons and physical therapists. The ASO is one of the leading ankle braces on the market due to its unique combination of comfort, support and durability. The contoured tongue provides exceptional fit and is constructed of light-weight yet durable CoolFlex material. This material also lines the inside back of the boot, providing increased comfort to the Achilles area. The boot has an invisible seam to provide superior comfort. The shoe lace is attached to the tongue to ensure that the lace is always centered. Finger loops at the end of the stabilizing straps assist in securing straps for optimum support. The ASO is manufactured to high quality standards in the United States of America by Medical Specialties, Inc.
feature_bullets: Stabilizing Straps form complete figure-eight to protect and support ankle
Ballistic nylon boot provides superior durability and strength
Elastic cuff closure enhances support and keeps laces and stabilizing straps secure
Bilateral design so each size will fit left or right foot; Low profile to fit in any type of shoe
Each ankle brace is sold separately; US manufacturing with higher quality control standards

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
